Title: Data Scientist Junior (Portfolio Management)
Description:
At Finsolutia we believe that the key to success is to have the best professionals in our team. For this reason, we are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Madrid. The Portfolio Management team is the key point of contact for clients/investors (typically PE funds), analyzing the portfolio performance, suggesting new strategies, and coordinating all internal teams. Portfolios are mostly NPL/REO books, although performing loans are also included in scope. Thus, we encourage you to sign up and become part of this great team.




üìàWhat will you do on a day-to-day basis?üìâ




Responsibilities will range from conducting quantitative investment analysis to preparing and attending investor presentations (typically in English).
Leverage data analytics and visualization tools (e.g., Python, SQL, Power BI) to support data-driven decision-making across investment and asset management activities.
Contribute to the development and optimization of internal processes, including automation and digital transformation initiatives using Python, Flask/Django.
Assist in the development of web applications and internal tools using React and modern web frameworks to streamline reporting, portfolio monitoring, and financial modeling.
Structure, design, and generate management and performance reports, integrating real-time data insights and visualizations.
Support the integration of machine learning models for predictive analysis in areas such as property valuation, investment risk, and market trends.
Collaborate cross-functionally to translate business needs into technical solutions and continuously enhance the analytical infrastructure.




üèÜWhat knowledge and skills will you need to have to succeed in the position?üèÜ




University or Master‚Äôs degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
Strong interest or background in applying technology and data science to financial analysis, investment modeling, or real estate analytics.
Proficient in MS Office tools, particularly Excel; comfortable working with Power BI for data visualization and business intelligence reporting.
Practical experience or familiarity with Python and its key data libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, etc.) for data analysis and machine learning.
Knowledge of SQL for data querying and database management.
Ability to manage multiple technology-driven projects under pressure and deliver in a fast-paced setting.
Strong analytical, procedural, and critical thinking skills, with a tech-savvy and data-driven approach.
Fluency in English is mandatory (both oral and written).
Demonstrated interest in Debt/Real Estate investment, Private Equity, and leveraging technology, data, and machine learning in the financial sector.
Mandatory: We are looking for a team player who enjoys sharing their experience and knowledge, and contributing to a positive and collaborative work environment




Nice To Haveüëåüëå




Exposure to backend web development using Flask or Django, or C# and frontend development using React.
Familiarity with C# for application development in business or financial environments.
Excellent organizational, communication, writing, and interpersonal skills.
High sense of responsibility and ability to work independently and take initiative.




üîùWhat can we offer you?üîù




To be part of a dynamic and constantly growing company.
To be in an excellent work environment that will favor your professional development.
You will have a competitive and flexible remuneration.
Flexibility in and out of the office.
The offer includes a competitive salary.




Come and join our team!




Privacy Note




At Finsolutia, we evaluate all candidates fairly and equitably, ensuring equal opportunities for all applicants. Our selection process is based solely on the skills, experience, and competencies required for the position. No candidate will be discriminated against based on race, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other personal characteristic. We are committed to providing an inclusive environment and equal opportunities for all candidates.




Please note that the personal data collected through this channel will be used exclusively for the professional management of the recruitment process in question. Your data will be processed and stored by Finsolutia Spain SLU in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of April 27, 2016 (GDPR). This information will be retained for a maximum period of 4 years in the event you participate in a recruitment process. You may, at any time, object to the storage and processing of your data, withdraw your consent, and exercise your rights of access, rectification, and erasure under the applicable regulations.

To exercise these rights, you may contact us in person or by post, enclosing a copy of your ID, at:

Recruitment Department ‚Äì Finsolutia Spain, SLU

Calle Cardenal Marcelo Sp√≠nola 14, 4th Floor, 28016 Madrid, Spain

Alternatively, you may send a written request along with a copy of an official identification document to: dpo@finsolutia.com

Title: Data Scientist Intern - Madrid
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic student to join our Maps Analytics and Data Engineering team in Madrid! As a Data Science Intern, you will immerse yourself in the geospatial data world, collecting, analyzing, and transforming data, and scaling-up processes to help us upgrade our maps for our end-customers!

At TomTom‚Ä¶you‚Äôll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow‚Äôs mobility for the better. We are proud to be one team of more than 5.000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens, and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.

You are‚Ä¶passionate about data processing, big data computing, statistical analysis, and analytic methods, applying machine learning models to industry problems. You will be part of agile unit and will be collaborating with engineers, data scientists, map and location experts. We look for people who are curious, innovative, out of the box thinkers, love taking risks and work to make our products and solutions better every day.

What You‚Äôll Do


You will help us collect large amounts of (geospatial) data and transform it into a more usable format
You will solve business-related problems using data-driven techniques
You will help us to stay on top of computational techniques such as big data computing, real-time computing, continuous development, ‚Ä¶
You will identify patterns in data, as well as spotting trends that can help improving the business‚Äôs bottom line
You will communicate and collaborate with Data Scientists, engineers, product managers and Maps Operations Team globally.
Dedicate part of your weekly schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments.
Work in a hybrid and flexible way, combining office and remote working, that will allow you find the perfect work-life balance


What You‚Äôll Need


You are enrolled in a Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or engineering, data science, Big Data or any other related field (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science,...)
You are either an EU citizen OR are enrolled in a Spanish university
You are fluent in English
You are eligibe to do a full-time internship (32-40 hours per week for 6 months)
You have programming experience with Python and SQL with knowledge of software engineering principles (Object-oriented programming, testing, ...)
You have experience working with the main python libraries for data processing (pyspark, pandas, numpy,‚Ä¶)
You have experience with data visualization (storytelling) (e.g., dash, streamlit)
Being familiar with Microsoft cloud computing (Azure & Databricks) or any other cloud experience is a plus!


What You Can Expect From Us


You will never get bored! A company culture that likes to work hard and play hard. We like to have fun. There is no sense coming to a job every day if you don‚Äôt like the people you work with.
A diverse, multi-cultural environment.
You will be part of an amazing team of data scientists always eager to help you learn and grow!
1.100 ‚Ç¨/month (gross salary based on full-time work)
A 6-month internship contract, with a perspective to join the company afterwards
Live and work in Madrid, a cool city with loads of inspiration!

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
This job is with TomTom, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

At TomTom...You'll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow's mobility for the better.We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens, and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.

You are...passionate about artificial intelligence, statistical analysis, and analytic methods, applying machine learning models to industry problems. You will be part of agile unit and will be collaborating with engineers, data engineers, map and location experts and fellow data scientists. We look for people who are curious, innovative, out of the box thinker, loves taking risk and work to make system better every day. What you'll do:


You will help us collect large amounts of unruly (spatial) data and transform it into a more usable format.
You will solve business-related problems using data-driven techniques.
You will help us to stay on top of analytical techniques such as machine learning, deep learning, and text analytics.
You will identify patterns in data, as well as spotting trends that can help improving the business's bottom line.
You will communicate and collaborate with both Software Engineers and with the Maps Operations Team globally.
Dedicate part of your weekly schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments, etc.
Work in a mostly-remote and flexible way that will allow you find the perfect work-life balance.


What you'll need:


You are enrolled in a Master's degree in data science, Big Data or any other related field for the whole duration of internship.
You are eligible for a full-time internship (40 hours per week) for 6 months.
You are fluent in English.
You have programming experience with Python and SQL.
Hands-on experience with statistical and predictive modeling using machine learning; knowledge of R is an added advantage.
Have some experience with data visualization (storytelling) (e.g., Matplotlib or Seaborn) is a plus.
Being familiar with Microsoft cloud computing (Azure & Databricks) or any other cloud experience is a plus.


What You Can Expect From Us


You will never get bored! A company culture that likes to work hard and play hard. We like to have fun. There is no sense coming to a job every day if you don't like the people you work with.
A diverse, multi-cultural environment.
You will be part of an amazing team of data scientists, always eager to help you learn and grow!
1100 ‚Ç¨/month (gross salary based on full-time work).
A 6-month internship contract, with a perspective to join the company afterwards.
Live and work in Madrid, a cool city with loads of inspiration!


Meet your teamWe're Maps, a product unit within TomTom's Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is comprised of over 2,000 people in 40 countries - all driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for the hundreds of millions of people using TomTom maps around the world. Joining our team, you'll help continuously innovate our map-making processes, create a real-time closed loop between detected changes in the real world and the users' map, and build maps that will enable the future of autonomous driving. Within Maps product unit, the Maps Analytics team is focused on creating efficient ways to state our map quality and drive insights to the map production teams that help the company evolve in a smart way.

Achieve more We are self-starters who play well with others. Every day, we solve new problems with creativity, meet new people and learn rapidly at our offices around the world. We will invest in your growth and are committed to supporting you. In everything we do, we're guided by six values: We care, putting our heart into what we do; we build trust (you can count on us); we create - driven to make a difference; we are confident, but don't boast; we keep it simple, since life is complex enough; and we have fun because life's too short to be boring.

After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout the process, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely, and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews through your onboarding.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employerWe celebrate diversity, thrive on each other's differences, and are committed to creating an inclusive environment at our offices around the world. Naturally, we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, national origin, genetics, or age.

Ready to move the world forward?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Nationale-Nederlanden, it's the person who makes the professional. Following the company's strategy, we are looking to strengthen our structure within our central offices located in Alcobendas, in a hybrid, flexible, and accommodating work environment.

On this occasion, we offer a vacancy for a Machine Learning Engineer for the Data ‚Äì Advanced Analytics & AI team.

What is the purpose/mission of the position?


Development, implementation, and maintenance of machine learning and generative AI systems.
Work alongside other data scientists, data analysts, business specialists, and other IT specialists in designing advanced analytics solutions.


What you will do?


Develop and productize Machine Learning models in the cloud using Azure and Databricks services
Perform feature engineering for data preparation for Machine Learning models
Collaborate with the Cloud team and the Data Science Hub in the implementation and maintenance of projects that use Generative AI
Optimize and improve the performance of Machine Learning models in the cloud
Work closely with business and IT teams to understand business requirements and objectives and design Machine Learning solutions that meet those requirements
Document and communicate results and findings to team members, stakeholders, and business and IT teams


What are we looking for?


Degree in a technical career (preferably Engineering or Physics) with a Master's in Data Science (desirable)
Advanced level of English
Advanced knowledge in Python and Spark, valuable in R
Desirable knowledge of Azure services, and desirable experience in Azure Cognitive Services and Databricks. Desirable knowledge in Terraform and Biceps
Desirable experience in the development and productization of Machine Learning models in the cloud.
Experience in CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Delivery): Skills to automate the deployment of Machine Learning models and applications


What do we offer?

Benefits

As part of our Employee Experience, we offer you a range of competitive benefits that are available to you in order to improve the physical, mental, and professional wellbeing of our workers. Among the benefits are:


We work with a hybrid model
Starting financial aid so you can equip your work space at home
Allowance and telework subventions
Flexible working hours and 2 months of intensive working hours in summer so you can fully take advantage of your time
We hire a life insurance and a pension plan for all our employees
We establish objectives bonus as a performance reward
You can get to the office as you please. We have a free parking lot for cars, motorbikes, electric cars with chargers, and bikes.
Get to know our flexible retribution facilities such as transport card, nursery checks, health insurance with Sanitas, trainings‚Ä¶
We care about people. That is why we are involved in society by facilitating volunteer actions and time to all our employees.
We care about your wellbeing. We have a Wellness Program available.
We are digital and we love technology. Also, every team works under agile methodology.


If you think that your profile can fit with us and you like who we are, do not hesitate to sign in to our offers. We are waiting for you!

In Nationale-Nederlanden we are committed with diversity. We are proud to be an inclusive organization and we offer equal opportunities, regardless of race, cultural background, gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, and sexual orientation. One of our core values is taking care of our employees so they can give their best within a respectful environment.
Show more

  • Advanced level of English
  • Advanced knowledge in Python and Spark, valuable in R
  • Desirable knowledge of Azure services, and desirable experience in Azure Cognitive Services and Databricks. Desirable knowledge in Terraform and Biceps
  • Desirable experience in the development and productization of Machine Learning models in the cloud.
  • Experience in CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Delivery): Skills to automate the deployment of Machine Learning models and applications

What do we offer?

Benefits

As part of our Employee Experience, we offer you a range of competitive benefits that are available to you in order to improve the physical, mental, and professional wellbeing of our workers. Among the benefits are:

  • We work with a hybrid model
  • Starting financial aid so you can equip your work space at home
  • Allowance and telework subventions
  • Flexible working hours and 2 months of intensive working hours in summer so you can fully take advantage of your time
  • We hire a life insurance and a pension plan for all our employees
  • We establish objectives bonus as a performance reward
  • You can get to the office as you please. We have a free parking lot for cars, motorbikes, electric cars with chargers, and bikes.
  • Get to know our flexible retribution facilities such as transport card, nursery checks, health insurance with Sanitas, trainings‚Ä¶
  • We care about people. That is why we are involved in society by facilitating volunteer actions and time to all our employees.
  • We care about your wellbeing. We have a Wellness Program available.
  • We are digital and we love technology. Also, every team works under agile methodology.

If you think that your profile can fit with us and you like who we are, do not hesitate to sign in to our offers. We are waiting for you!

In Nationale-Nederlanden we are committed with diversity. We are proud to be an inclusive organization and we offer equal opportunities, regardless of race, cultural background, gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, and sexual orientation. One of our core values is taking care of our employees so they can give their best within a respectful environment.

Title: Senior (Applied) Data Scientist
Description:
About PriceHubble

PriceHubble is on a mission to transform how real estate and financial professionals make decisions. We're a fast-growing European B2B SaaS company that leverages the power of AI and big data to bring next-level transparency and insight to the property market. Our digital solutions empower clients across the real estate value chain - from banks to asset managers - with the most precise property valuations and forward-looking market intelligence. Already live in 11 markets across Europe, Asia, and North America, and backed by a team of 200+ forward-thinkers, PriceHubble is scaling fast and going global.

The opportunity

At PriceHubble, we organize our teams into Tribes. Each Tribe is responsible for a specific part of our product. They identify customer needs, create solutions, and ensure everything runs smoothly. Each Tribe operates independently, managing all aspects of its area. Engineers rotate between project teams and a group focused on maintenance and technical improvements.

The Property Intelligence Tribe provides insights to make informed real estate decisions. This includes assessing property values, tracking market trends, evaluating investment opportunities, and improving property management. Our mission is to deliver accurate property information for every residential property in our areas of operation. In that, Tribe members create the unique insights and intellectual property that drive our products.

The Tribe is a distributed team of engineers from 6 nationalities, located in 5 different European countries.

As an applied Senior Data Scientist, you will work on the ML systems that drive the core services of our platform. You will design, implement, and maintain Automated Valuation Models (AVMs) that professionals trust for assessing residential property values.

The impact you will have


Develop product features that directly drive revenue growth. Our valuation models are major selling points for our customers
Navigate cost-value trade-offs to make decisions that deliver value to customers at an appropriate cost
Implement solutions that work well in over 10 countries, while considering local specifics in your model
Lead a project from concept to launch, working with a temporary team of engineers
Raise the bar and drive the team to deliver high-quality products, services, and processes
Improve the performance and cost-efficiency of our ML models and pipelines at scale
Maintain and monitor the ML systems owned by your team


Requirements


A product-oriented mindset and enthusiasm for contributing to user-facing products. For you, ML is a means to an end - you're focused on delivering value to customers
Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written, that allow you to communicate effectively with cross-functional partners and mentor fellow engineers. In our distributed team setup, strong writing communication skills are essential
Hands-on, you value writing clear, simple, and maintainable code. You understand that code is read more often than it is written
You embrace a growth mindset. You always continue learning and always seek new challenges.
Over 3 years of industry experience applying machine learning to solve business problems and writing production ML pipelines
AI fluency. You use AI tools daily in your development workflow. You understand what works and what doesn't, and you know how to get better results faster


Bonus


Previous experience in PropTech
Proficient in working with geospatial data and leveraging geospatial features


We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Benefits

Join an ambitious and hungry team and enjoy the following benefits:

üí∞ Competitive salary because we always want to attract the best talents.

üìò Learning & Development program - We want you to feel happy, confident about improving your skills, experience level as well as your personal development success.

üè¢ Very well-located offices with a great remote work policy and the possibility to work from different places.

üïì Flexible working hours and work life balance.

Title: Operations Associate, Louisville, #143
Description:
Gopuff is looking for Operations Associates (OAs) to join the operations team. Directly reporting to a Site Leader, OAs play an essential role at Gopuff that requires drive, perseverance, positivity, and enthusiasm for the challenge. You will accomplish a variety of operations responsibilities including picking, packing, receiving product both within our site and accompanying kitchen (if applicable), and working with our partner drivers.

Customers turn to Gopuff to provide their everyday essentials‚Äîday and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks.

Responsibilities:


Pick and pack items for dispatch to customers
Receive and unpack pallets of product from vendors, ensure physical inventory count matches purchase order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies
Manage inventory and re-shelving of canceled orders
Clean and organize sales floor and overall facility
Manage waste and spoilage through strict compliance with FIFO practice
Contact customer for substituted or out-of-stock items
Handle, scan and move product in a safe and well-organized manner
Stand, push, pull, squat, bend, reach and walk during shifts
Use carts, pallet jacks, dollies and other equipment to move product
Handle products that may contain tobacco, nicotine, and/or alcohol
Work in freezer locations periodically throughout shifts
Capability to walk several flights of steps periodically throughout the day
Prepare quality beverages and food menu items for all customers by observing all recipes and presentation standards
Ensure accuracy of all food and beverage packaged for delivery
Follow health, safety and sanitation guidelines for all products
Receive and put away order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies when they do not match expiration requirements
Maintain Kitchen Facility organization and standards to ensure resources can be accessed while managing waste and spoilage through mindful pouring and food preparation
Prepare, package and stage/handoff orders


Qualifications:


High School Diploma or GED Equivalent
Experience working in a restaurant or retail environment (preferred, not required)
The ability to work a fluid schedule and be available during peak shifts (1st, 2nd, 3rd shifts)
General working knowledge of basic web-based software applications (e.g. Google G-Suite)
Stand and walk for the duration of an assigned shift
Lift up to 49 pounds
Available to work flexible hours that may include mornings, evenings, weekends, nights and holidays


At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Senior Water/Wastewater Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a Senior Water/Wastewater Engineer to lead the planning, design, and delivery of essential infrastructure projects that support sustainable, high-performing communities. In this role, you will provide technical leadership in delivering water and wastewater solutions for municipal and public agency clients. From treatment plant upgrades to pipeline and pump station design, your work will have a direct impact on the reliability, efficiency, and long-term resilience of critical water infrastructure. You will also play a key role in mentoring staff, managing projects, and contributing to the growth and success of our water practice. This position can be based out of our office in Louisville, KY or Jeffersonville, IN.

Lochmueller Group is a regional engineering consulting firm with an emphasis on infrastructure.‚ÄØ‚ÄØWe provide multi-disciplined services for a variety of public agencies and private entities, including transportation; water resources; environmental analysis & permitting; construction engineering & inspection; traffic engineering & transportation planning; surveying; and land acquisition & appraisal.

For over 40 years, Lochmueller Group has helped communities reinvent their future through thoughtful, actionable planning and design.‚ÄØOur dedication to building a team that demonstrates our corporate values (CARDIA) is what sets us apart:

CARDIA: Creativity; Accountability; Respect; Dedication; Integrity; Achievement

Lochmueller Group provides an excellent workplace culture established by our people who share these values. We are a 100% employee-owned (ESOP) company, and our people are invested in the success and continued development of each other and the firm. This is a great place to build a career and grow with a company that is dedicated to quality and service.

Key responsibilities will include:


Managing water and wastewater infrastructure projects of varying complexity
Providing leadership in the planning, design, and execution of major water/wastewater projects, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and best practices in utility infrastructure
Preparing project documents and designs, conducting analyses, interpreting data, and planning and coordinating specific aspects of water/wastewater engineering work
Reviewing and approving project deliverables, including drawings and specifications
Serving as a technical expert in water and wastewater engineering
Performing QA/QC on project deliverables, ensuring the technical accuracy and constructability of water/wastewater engineering designs and documentation
Mentoring and coaching junior and mid-level engineers
Overseeing project teams, ensuring alignment with technical standards, project schedules, and organizational goals
Collaborating with senior management on strategic planning for water/wastewater services and assisting with business development efforts including client engagement and proposal development
Preparing proposals and/or funding applications





Qualifications for this role:


Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in Civil Engineering or related field
Professional Engineer (PE) license
Typically requires 12+ years of relevant and progressive water and wastewater engineering experience
Proven success in managing large and/or complex projects
Proficiency in project scheduling software and tools
Proficiency with relevant engineering software and tools for design, project management, and analysis
Strong leadership and strategic thinking skills
Excellent communication and client management abilities
Proficiency with Microsoft Office products including: Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
Valid Driver's License





What we offer:


Health & Wellness (medical, dental, vision, disability, and basic life insurance w/ option for additional voluntary life insurance)
Work/Life Balance (vacation, holidays, sick leave, parental leave, flexible scheduling)
Wealth-Building (401k w/ company match, student loan repayment benefit, ESOP, competitive compensation package)
Professional Benefits (professional membership dues, career & educational development)





Lochmueller Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Lochgroup fully supports and maintains compliance with all state, federal, and local regulations. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local laws. Some of the content in this job post may have been auto-generated using advanced AI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role:

By emphasizing ONE Park, ONE mission, ONE team, the Data Analyst enhances operational efficiencies at the credit union by conducting data manipulation and modeling. This role integrates data from multiple sources to generate required data elements, while providing high-quality service to internal and external members. The Data Analyst supports all departments by maintaining report forms, dashboards, and other information portals, creating specifications for reports based on business needs, and assisting in identifying and resolving problems. Key functions include ad-hoc reporting, data analytics, predictive modeling, outcomes analysis, and visualization.


THIS POSITION IS HYBRID AND WILL REQUIRE WEEKLY OFFICE VISITS.**



Essential Functions & Responsibilities:


Assist in setting priorities for current and future work with data on a daily basis, including translating requests for reports and analysis into an actionable data question, executing and communicating these analyses. Work independently on jointly determined work and projects. Work directly with CFO regarding credit union processes and special projects as needed.
Seek and make business case for opportunities where predictive/prescriptive analytics can add value for the credit union.
Work with third-party vendors to prioritize data science activities and contribute to the direction of future work.
Maintain a high level of organizational and operational awareness, independently seeking out opportunities to enhance understanding and disseminate this understanding across the Data Analytics Department.
Seek to identify areas that may cause risk or affect the credit union‚Äôs overall financial position. Research and make recommendations resulting in organizational improvements in policies or processes.
Communicate the results of analysis and modeling to stakeholders.
Research and make recommendations resulting in organizational improvements in policies or processes.
Perform other duties as assigned.



Performance Measurements:


To be an ambassador of Park's culture supporting the credit union's mission to build thriving communities together ensuring words and actions align with the Park VIBE that defines our Core Values:
Vibrant Connections
Inclusive Excellence
Bold Compassion
Endless Empowerment
To provide friendly, professional and accurate service and support to all members and coworkers.
To produce all reports and analyses in a timely manner.
To provide informed, professional assistance to others in the Credit Union regarding data science.
To maintain a professional work environment, promote teamwork, build respect among coworkers and present a businesslike appearance.
To follow all security policies and procedures and report discrepancies or suspicious activity to manager immediately.



Knowledge and Skills:

Experience Two to three years of similar or related experience.

Intermediate SQL experience.

Financial or Credit Union industry experience a plus.

Education (1) A bachelor's degree, or (2) achievement of formal certifications recognized in the industry as equivalent to a bachelor's degree (e.g. information technology certifications in lieu of a degree).

Interpersonal Skills Work involves much personal contact with others inside and/or outside the organization for the purpose of first-level conflict resolution, building relationships, and soliciting cooperation. Discussions involve a higher degree of confidentiality and discretion, requiring diplomacy and tact in communication.

Other Skills Advanced experience with statistical programming skills (i.e. R, Python).

Experience with data visualization tools (i.e., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.).

In-depth experience in Microsoft Excel including formulas, pivots, vlookups, charts, and graphs.

Knowledge and understanding of organizational data systems.

Physical Requirements

WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the essential duties of this position, the employee is regularly exposed to a general office environment and interaction with customers.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those required to successfully perform the essential functions of this position, but do not necessarily constitute an exhaustive list of all essential functions. To the extent required by any applicable law, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions where this can be done without posing a direct threat to self or others.

While performing the essential duties of this position, the employee frequently must sit, stand, and walk short distances. The employee frequently uses hands and fingers to count currency and handle, manipulate, and feel objects, documents, and office tools and equipment. Reads, writes, listens, speaks, and uses personal computers, copiers, telephones, and other office equipment and software throughout the work day. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, bend, squat, and reach overhead with hands and arms. Occasionally pushing and pulling of office furniture and other objects. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds and on occasion lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Park Community Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer/VETERANS/DISABLED

Title: UIPath Developer
Description:
Description

Who We Are:

Machinify is a leading healthcare intelligence company with expertise across the payment continuum, delivering unmatched value, transparency, and efficiency to health plan clients across the country. Deployed by over 60 health plans, including many of the top 20, and representing more than 160 million lives, Machinify brings together a fully configurable and content-rich, AI-powered platform along with best-in-class expertise. We‚Äôre constantly reimagining what‚Äôs possible in our industry, creating disruptively simple, powerfully clear ways to maximize financial outcomes and drive down healthcare costs.

Location:

This role is fully remote

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Machinify will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

About The Role

We are seeking a skilled UiPath Developer to join our dynamic team. The primary focus of this role is to automate disparate systems to enhance data collection efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in UiPath, PowerAutomate, and Intelligent Document Processing. Additionally, experience with C# and Angular is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities


Automation Development: Design, develop, and implement automation solutions using UiPath to streamline and optimize data collection processes across various systems.
PowerAutomate Integration: Utilize PowerAutomate to create workflows that integrate with existing systems and enhance automation capabilities.
Intelligent Document Processing: Implement and manage Intelligent Document Processing solutions to automate the extraction and processing of data from various document types.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, data analysts, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver effective automation solutions.
Maintenance and Support: Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing automation solutions, ensuring they continue to meet business needs and operate efficiently.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all automation processes, including design specifications, test plans, and user guides.


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:


UiPath: Proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions using UiPath.
PowerAutomate: Hands-on experience with Microsoft PowerAutomate for creating and managing workflows.
Intelligent Document Processing: Experience with Intelligent Document Processing tools and techniques.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.


Nice To Have


C#: Experience with C# programming for custom automation solutions.
Angular: Familiarity with Angular for developing user interfaces and enhancing automation solutions.


Why Join Us


Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and continuous improvement.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Collaborative Culture: Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions are valued.


Pay range: $90,000 - $120,000

This is an exempt position. For Salary positions only: The salary range is for Base Salary. Compensation will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, skill set, years of experience, and the employee's geographic location.

What's In It For You


PTO, Paid Holidays, and Volunteer Days
Eligibility for health, vision and dental coverage, 401(k) plan participation with company match, and flexible spending accounts
Tuition Reimbursement
Eligibility for company-paid benefits including life insurance, short-term disability, and parental leave
Remote and hybrid work options
Support for security certifications and professional development


At Machinify, we‚Äôre reimagining a simpler way forward. This begins with our employees. We are innovators who value integrity, teamwork, accuracy, and flexibility. We do the right thing, and we listen to the needs of our clients and their members. As tenured experts with unmatched experience, we champion diverse perspectives that help us to better understand and serve our clients.

Our values come to life through our culture. We embrace flexible working arrangements that allow our employees to bring innovation to life in the way that best suits their productivity. We work cross-functionally, abandoning silos, to bring innovative and accurate solutions to market. We invest in each other through ongoing education and team celebrations, and we give back to our communities through dedicating days for volunteering. Together, Machinify is making healthcare work better for everyone, and we‚Äôre passionate about a future with better outcomes for all.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Machinify is an employment at will employer. We participate in E-Verify as required by applicable law. In accordance with applicable state laws, we do not inquire about salary history during the recruitment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application or recruitment process, please contact our People Operations team at

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in UiPath, PowerAutomate, and Intelligent Document Processing. Additionally, experience with C# and Angular is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities

  • Automation Development: Design, develop, and implement automation solutions using UiPath to streamline and optimize data collection processes across various systems.
  • PowerAutomate Integration: Utilize PowerAutomate to create workflows that integrate with existing systems and enhance automation capabilities.
  • Intelligent Document Processing: Implement and manage Intelligent Document Processing solutions to automate the extraction and processing of data from various document types.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, data analysts, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver effective automation solutions.
  • Maintenance and Support: Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing automation solutions, ensuring they continue to meet business needs and operate efficiently.
  • Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all automation processes, including design specifications, test plans, and user guides.

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:

  • UiPath: Proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions using UiPath.
  • PowerAutomate: Hands-on experience with Microsoft PowerAutomate for creating and managing workflows.
  • Intelligent Document Processing: Experience with Intelligent Document Processing tools and techniques.
  • Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

Nice To Have

  • C#: Experience with C# programming for custom automation solutions.
  • Angular: Familiarity with Angular for developing user interfaces and enhancing automation solutions.

Why Join Us

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Professional Growth: Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Collaborative Culture: Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions are valued.

Pay range: $90,000 - $120,000

This is an exempt position. For Salary positions only: The salary range is for Base Salary. Compensation will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, skill set, years of experience, and the employee's geographic location.

What's In It For You

  • PTO, Paid Holidays, and Volunteer Days
  • Eligibility for health, vision and dental coverage, 401(k) plan participation with company match, and flexible spending accounts
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Eligibility for company-paid benefits including life insurance, short-term disability, and parental leave
  • Remote and hybrid work options
  • Support for security certifications and professional development

At Machinify, we‚Äôre reimagining a simpler way forward. This begins with our employees. We are innovators who value integrity, teamwork, accuracy, and flexibility. We do the right thing, and we listen to the needs of our clients and their members. As tenured experts with unmatched experience, we champion diverse perspectives that help us to better understand and serve our clients.

Our values come to life through our culture. We embrace flexible working arrangements that allow our employees to bring innovation to life in the way that best suits their productivity. We work cross-functionally, abandoning silos, to bring innovative and accurate solutions to market. We invest in each other through ongoing education and team celebrations, and we give back to our communities through dedicating days for volunteering. Together, Machinify is making healthcare work better for everyone, and we‚Äôre passionate about a future with better outcomes for all.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Machinify is an employment at will employer. We participate in E-Verify as required by applicable law. In accordance with applicable state laws, we do not inquire about salary history during the recruitment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application or recruitment process, please contact our People Operations team at

Title: Web Application Developer Intern
Description:
Louisville, KY, USA Req #12036

Thursday, July 24, 2025

What We Need

Corpay is currently looking to hire a Web Application Developer Intern for our Stored Value Solutions (SVS) division. This position falls under our gift cards line of business and is located in Louisville, KY. In this role, the Web Application Developer Intern will design, develop, and maintain SVS‚Äô clients facing applications to support business requirements. Follows approved life cycle methodologies, creates design documents, and writes code, tests, and configures a variety of DevOps utilities. Resolves technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation.

How We Work

As an intern you will be expected to work in a hybrid environment reporting to our Louisville office location. Corpay will set you up for success by providing:


Company-issued equipment
Formal, hands-on training


Role Responsibilities


Designing, developing and maintaining custom applications or configuration of corporate application systems and services traditionally utilized by internal employees and external clients and customers.
Analyzing and designing application systems encompassing the development, modification and translation of user requirements.
Planning, investigating and proposing systems and application solutions.
Preparing workflow for writing, testing and maintaining computer programs.
Architects program specifications and business logic.
Creating and updating user manual and other documentation.
Correcting, testing and documenting changes to existing programs.
Conducting training and presentation.
Supporting existing applications.
Night and weekend rotation required.
Other duties as assigned


Qualifications & Skills


Majoring in: Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics or related subject.
Hands-on experience in object-oriented language/frameworks, relational database management systems, web technologies, and/or other software application development platforms.
Strong written, verbal, analytical, and interpersonal skills required.
Must display maturity and a high level of professionalism.
Able to work in a team environment
Students must be currently enrolled at an accredited college or university in a Bachelor or Graduate degree program through the duration of the internship.
Must be committed to working a 40-hour work week for 10-12 weeks during the summer months
Stay up to date with recent technological developments and best practices in Application Development.
Consults with users to identify current operating procedures and clarify program objectives.
Excellent communication, design, and documentation skills are required.


Other details


Job Family IT
Pay Type Hourly
Employment Indicator Employee

Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (AEC Industry)
Description:
Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer

Service Group: Assigned Service Group

Reports To: Service Group Director & Director of Mechanical Engineering

I. Summary

The role of a Senior Mechanical Engineer is to provide engineering leadership for technical challenges, on projects, to clients, and within the mechanical department. Technical capabilities required of a Senior Mechanical Engineer include all engineering necessary for HVAC plants, systems, hydronic distribution, air side distribution and life safety systems.

II. Core Competencies And Responsibilities

Engineering


Perform detailed mechanical surveys
Perform engineering tasks and work with engineers and designers to produce projects in design
Able to bring multiple project types to completion from design inception to construction closeout
Review mechanical designs
Perform Construction Administration including but not limited to site observation reports, punch list, submittals and RFI responses
Able to troubleshoot complex field mechanical issues
Research and prepare mechanical engineering reports for feasibility studies, life cycle analysis, and other similar reports


Client


Understands complex mechanical engineering principals used in design and confidently discuss them with internal and external clients
Participates in business development activities


Project Performance


Completes engineering tasks within the project budget
Completes engineering tasks to meet the project schedule
Is able to provide feedback to supervisors, project managers, and principals related to project performance
Address change orders and prepares responses to client
Capable of estimating required engineering hours to complete a tasks and prepare corresponding engineering fees


Supervisory


There may be direct supervisory responsibilities associated with this position
Studio directors may assign engineers, associates or co-ops to be under your supervision


III. Technical Capabilities


Understands and can apply hydronic piping engineering principals to systems and plants providing condenser water, geothermal, chilled water, hot water, steam, and refrigerant
Understands and can apply design principals of hydronic systems and plants
Understands building pressure and stack effect and can engineer systems to address building pressure including life safety systems for hoist way and stairwell pressurization and smoke control
Creates and understands all aspects of single line diagrams
Develop engineering sketches or schematics, layouts, details and/or drawings
Understands and can proficiently reference and apply applicable codes
Understands and can apply SMACNA standards to all ductwork pressure classes and type
Able to edit Mechanical specifications
Perform advanced building, system, and plant level HVAC calculations for complicated systems
Research and prepare reports for feasibility studies, life cycle cost analysis and other similar reports
Performs and demonstrates HVAC energy compliance using energy compliance software and provide supporting documentation


IV. Qualifications

Licensure


Professional Engineering license is required


Membership

Recommended Memberships And Participation In Professional Organizations Include


ASHRAE
SMACNA


Certifications

Recommended Certifications Include But Are Not Limited To


LEED AP
Certified Energy Manager
Well Building
ASHRAE Commissioning Professional (BCxP)
ASHRAE Assessment Professional (BEAP)
ASHRAE Energy Modeling Professional (BEMP)
ASHRAE High Performance Building Design Professional (HBDP)
ASHRAE Certified HVAC Designer (CHD)


Experience


10+ years working in an MEP engineering consulting firm on multiple building types
6+ years working as a licensed professional engineer
Project experience across multiple market segments preferred (Healthcare, Education, Commercial, Civic, Retail)


Computer Skills


Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs including Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams
Proficient in Autodesk Revit


Expectations


Demonstrate acceptance of responsibility; show pride in work performed; demonstrate flexibility in acceptance of assignments and schedules; maintain professional behavior and appearance; exhibit dependability

Title: Product Development Engineer
Description:
Description

Position at Samtec, Inc

Founded in 1976, Samtec is a privately held, $950 million global manufacturer of a broad line of electronic interconnect solutions, including High-Speed Board-to-Board, High-Speed Cables, Mid-Board and Panel Optics, Precision RF, Flexible Stacking, and Micro/Rugged components and cables. Samtec Technology Centers are dedicated to developing and advancing technologies, strategies and products to optimize both the performance and cost of a system from the bare die to an interface 100 meters away, and all interconnect points in between. With 40+ international locations and products sold in more than 125 different countries, Samtec‚Äôs global presence enables its unmatched customer service.


THIS POSITION WILL BE LOCATED ONSITE AT SAMTEC - NEW ALBANY, IN **


Summary/Objective: The Product Engineer will design and develop solutions related to the following criteria: capacity expansions, cost down, market needs, product redesign/review, risk mitigation, and quality (internal and external).

Essential Functions/ Responsibilities


Make significant contributions to design, development, and validation of connector solutions (including, but not limited to, board to board, cable, power, high speed, and panel mount products).
Works directly with purchasing, quality, manufacturing engineering, test engineering, process engineering, electroplating, suppliers, product management, and other necessary groups as a cross functional team to develop products/solutions.
Works hands on to identify problems during product development and/or when quality concerns arise.
Adhere to all corporate engineering standards including, but not limited to, documentation, file management, part modeling, and part simulation.
Excellent organizational and time management skills for tracking projects.
Responsible for administrative tasks as needed.
Must be a self-starter with excellent communication skills and demonstrated problem solving ability.
Willing to travel to vendors and/or Samtec facilities outside New Albany as needed.


‚ÄúThe responsibilities as defined are intended to serve as a general guideline for this position. Associates may be asked to perform additional tasks depending on strengths and capabilities‚Äù

Required Experience


2+ years of experience in design/development/manufacturing of complex assemblies.
Proficient in MS Office Applications: PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and Outlook.
Experience in data analysis (Minitab and/or JMP are ideal).
Experience in electrical connector design is preferred. Plastic injection molding, and progressive die stamping experience is desired.
3D software experience is required. SolidWorks background is preferred.
Solid understanding and application of physics and engineering fundamentals.
Proven problem solver - demonstrated experience of data-driven root cause analysis.
Lifting Requirements: Medium Work ‚Äì Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist.
Must be able to sit for more than 90 consecutive minutes, and not suffer from any sensory deprivation and/or paralysis of the limbs.


Preferred Education


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering Technology, or equivalent.
Technical or engineering experience can substitute for preferred education.


SAMTEC, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating a diverse environment. All employment decisions at Samtec are based in business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, pregnancy or parental status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender and/or gender identity/expression, marital status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws.

Title: Lab Assistant - Part-Time
Description:
Part-Time Shift - Hours are 2:00 AM-6:00 AM or 3:00 AM- 7:00 AM - Tuesday-Saturday

Exciting Opportunity for Lab Assistants

Why Join Us? At HealthTrackRx, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of patient sample information. You'll be part of a dedicated team that strives for excellence in every detail while ensuring the type of swift workflow in the laboratory that allows physicians to diagnose and treat infections faster than ever. Your work will directly contribute to the overall success of our laboratory operations and accomplishing our company mission: Getting People Healthier Faster.

We are seeking detail-oriented, organized, and passionate Laboratory Assistants that are eager to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. If you're passionate about precision and are committed to upholding the highest laboratory standards, we want you on our team!

What You'll Need


Overnight availability
Candidates must have a High School diploma or equivalent
At least 6 months of experience working in a laboratory environment
Proficiency with the MS Office Suite


What You'll Do


Ensure Precision: Review all patient sample information for accuracy and compliance with company and regulatory standards.
Accession Samples: Process patient sample information and physician test orders into our Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) accurately.
Verify Compliance: Ensure all required information per HIPAA/CAP/CLIA standards is obtained and verified on all orders.
Handle Missing Information: Identify any missing information and follow proper procedures to address it.
Digitize Records: Scan patient requisitions for electronic medical records.
Maintain Excellence: Keep an error rate below 0.10%, with the ultimate goal of achieving zero errors per month.


What You'll Get


Fast access to our robust health and wellness benefits offerings
Financial peace of mind through our retirement benefits including expert consultation
Continuing education opportunities with our generous tuition reimbursement of up to $5,000+ per year.
Developmental opportunities through continuous improvement and innovation as well as professional development.
Time off to recharge through PTO and company-paid holidays
Most importantly, a sense of purpose in your work


Ready to Make a Difference? If you're ready to take the next step in your career and be part of something truly exciting, apply now to join our team. Together, we'll shape the future of infectious disease testing and make a positive impact on global health.
Show more

Title: Mechanic B
Description:
Schedule: Shift varies. Availability to work nights, weekends, and holidays is required. GENERAL SUMMARY:

Works under the direction of Mechanic ‚ÄúA‚Äù; replaces Inspector ‚ÄúB‚Äù and Hostler when required. T his position will support a safety and customer service culture through programs, procedures, and other related work to achieve TARC‚Äôs mission and strategic outcomes. The position is responsible for meeting or exceeding all TARC policies and procedures with strict adherence to all local, state, and federal regulations; and performing related duties as assigned .

Supervisory Responsibilities

None

Essential Duties And Responsibilities


Under direction of Mechanic ‚ÄúA‚Äù diagnoses malfunctions and performs vehicle repairs in accordance with all relevant local, state and federal guidelines and requirements.
Operates company truck to pick up parts at other locations.
Under direction of Mechanic ‚ÄúA‚Äù assists with ‚Äúroad/service calls.
Responsible for ensuring duties of the position are performed in a safe/effective manner.
Under direction of Mechanic ‚ÄúA‚Äù performs basic troubleshooting on electrical and mechanical systems.
Records time spent, parts used, and repairs and/or maintenance conducted on appropriate forms.
Identifies and reports any additional maintenance and/or repairs found necessary.
Performs inspections required by company and government entities as required.
Performs the duties of Hostler when required, including operation of coach. (See Hostler position description).
Operates forklift to change fare boxes
Performs other duties as assigned


MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:


High School Diploma or GED equivalent.
Some Diesel and/or automotive mechanic verifiable work experience.
May have technical college training in diesel of medium to heavy duty equipment mechanics or related experience.
Must be at least 18 years of age
Possession of, or ability to obtain, a valid Kentucky or Indiana Commercial Class B Driver's License with a passenger and air brakes endorsements within 60 days of hire.
Successful performance on pre-employment tests.


Note: An equivalent combination of related education and experience may be substituted for the above stated minimums excluding High School Diploma, GED, Licenses, or Certifications.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


Must be able to successfully pass a DOT Physical including bending, stooping, kneeling, climbing, or crouching.
Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds.
Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, using appropriate English grammar and syntax.
Ability to safety and properly operate a variety of hand and power tools.
Ability to user computerized diagnostic equipment.
Must have the ability to safely and properly operate a coach or other vehicle.


WORKING CONDITIONS:

Incumbents generally work in a noisy environment with adequate light and temperature. There may be occasional exposure‚ÄØto‚ÄØextreme temperatures, loud noise, fumes, odors, dust, mist, gases, and poor ventilation; must be able to lift up to 75 lbs. Work will require mobility including lifting or moving materials.

This position requires a pre-employment screening.

Americans With Disabilities Act (ada) Compliance

Reasonable accommodations may be made for those who are not able to perform the essential duties of the job.

SAFETY SENSITIVE POSITION: Yes

  • Must be able to successfully pass a DOT Physical including bending, stooping, kneeling, climbing, or crouching.
  • Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds.
  • Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, using appropriate English grammar and syntax.
  • Ability to safety and properly operate a variety of hand and power tools.
  • Ability to user computerized diagnostic equipment.
  • Must have the ability to safely and properly operate a coach or other vehicle.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Incumbents generally work in a noisy environment with adequate light and temperature. There may be occasional exposure‚ÄØto‚ÄØextreme temperatures, loud noise, fumes, odors, dust, mist, gases, and poor ventilation; must be able to lift up to 75 lbs. Work will require mobility including lifting or moving materials.

This position requires a pre-employment screening.

Americans With Disabilities Act (ada) Compliance

Reasonable accommodations may be made for those who are not able to perform the essential duties of the job.

SAFETY SENSITIVE POSITION: Yes

Title: Part-Time Lecturers - GEN 100
Description:
Department:

Location:

Belknap Campus

Time Type:

Worker Type:

Temporary (Fixed Term)

Job Req ID:

R106745

Position Description:

The College of Arts & Sciences invites applications for Part-Time Lecturer (PTL) instructors for GEN 100: Student Success Center FYE and GEN 101: Arts & Sciences FYE for the 2025-2026 Academic Year. These courses are 1 credit hour and held the first half of the semester. This position allows instructors to have direct contact with incoming students, grow in their facilitation and classroom management skills, and foster connections with others across the University community. We are looking for individuals who want to positively impact the lives of our students and support student success.

Course topics may include college technology, time management, campus resources, success strategies, major and career exploration, personality types, career values, academic planning, involvement, and more. Sample course syllabi, lesson plans, presentations, activities, Blackboard shells, and other resources will be provided, but instructors are encouraged to adapt materials to fit their style. PTLs will be supported throughout the experience, including a required training before the semester begins, a required debrief at the end of the course, occasional individual meetings with the FYE coordinator, and optional weekly instructor support meetings.

The majority of the course sessions are in-person on Belknap Campus, but some asynchronous online sections may be available.

Instructors are expected to utilize Blackboard to submit a finalized course syllabus, provide developmentally meaningful feedback, present engaging learning experiences, respond to students in a timely manner, communicate regularly with FYE coordinator, submit final grades within university deadlines, and comply with university requirements.

Qualifications:

Master's degree or 18+ hours of graduate coursework completed from an accredited institution. (Note: Candidates whose highest degree is a bachelor's can be considered if they have substantial relevant experience or student contact as part of their primary responsibilities.)

Please submit resume/CV, graduate college transcripts, and a cover letter. Your cover letter should address the reason for your interest, fit for working with first-year students, and any relevant teaching or facilitation experience.

Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until positions are filled.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Title: Vibration Analyst
Description:
Company Description




IVC Technologies is a leading provider of Condition Based Monitoring (CBM) services with 40 Years of history, and more than 50 certified analysts servicing over 500 industrial customers in North America. We are a privately owned company in the best sense of the word, with unparalleled culture and continuous development opportunities.




We provide a unique combination of on-site CBM services, advanced testing, and wireless-based remote monitoring packages, to deliver best-in-class custom solutions for our customers across the country. Our customer base includes some of the biggest names in the industry, which means a large variety of facilities and learning opportunities for all our employees.




Our analysts operate the most modern tools and systems and are supported 24/7 by leading experts in the industry. We provide internal training programs covering multiple technologies, with theoretical and hands-on training, as well as extensive mentorship effort for the less experienced team members.




In terms of culture, IVC is proud to foster flexibility and independence in our employees, which tends to attract people with strong character, high resilience, and get-it-done attitudes. We are a great fit for professionals with a sense of ownership, who appreciate being given freedom to create their own schedule, deliver high quality service, and create long-lasting relationships with customers.




Role Description




This is a FULL-TIME ON-SITE role located in the Louisville, Kentucky metro area. Successful applicants will be engaged full-time on a specific single customer site, without the need for regional travel. The role involves day-to-day tasks that include:




Regular interaction with customers and scheduling of your on-site services
Maintain vibration databases in line with IVC standards and to customer‚Äôs expectations
On-site data collection and predictive analysis, according to company standards
Create analytical summary reports, according to company standards
Isolate and identify failure modes in industrial equipment
Communicate findings and produce deliverables to customers in a timely and professional way
Submit documented case studies for customers to demonstrate value creation
Perform remote surveillance and analysis, where wireless systems are present
Maintain customer relationships with appropriate on-site contacts
Proactively build trust and maintain good communication with everyone on-site and off-site
Perform one-off field services when asked by customers or IVC peers
Embracing exemplary safety culture and ensuring compliance with customer‚Äôs standards, OSHA, and other applicable standards




Qualifications




Vibration Analysis skills, with other predictive skills being an asset (Infrared, U/S, Oil, etc.)
Analytical skills with the ability to interpret results and make recommendations
Experience in troubleshooting and condition monitoring
Good understanding of machinery operation
Experience working in an industrial setting
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and remotely
Certification in Vibration Analysis
Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or related field is a plus




Candidates must be authorized to work in the US to be considered for this position.

Title: Info Systems Technician
Description:
Description

Summary Objective

The purpose of this position is to input data and query records, create and modify computer applications to generate reports and charts to summarize or track operations and activities, to produce costs or financial reports, or provide other data output.

This class works under general supervision, independently developing work methods and sequences.

Examples of Duties

Essential Functions

The essential functions listed below are those that represent the majority of the time spent working in this class. Management may assign additional functions related to the type of work of the class as necessary.


Generates reports and charts to summarize or track operations and activities, to produce costs or financial reports, or provide other data output.
Queries computer records and files to display or report information or to respond to requests for information.
Notifies computer professionals to obtain assistance in correcting system errors or to request service or repair.
Inputs, imports, updates and appends data, links tables and databases, designs queries, and creates macros to view, produce data output, and analyze trends.
Schedules, runs, and distributes periodic reports and printouts.
Explains and discusses computer programs, data summarization and report form output requirements with staff and recommends changes to improve the format, use, efficiency and utilization of reports.
Provides technical assistance and instruction, and communicates with and assists users concerning computer operations, data base information, software and hardware capabilities, and to resolve problems and malfunctions.
Researches and compiles information, verifies data, reports findings, and conducts special projects.
Performs hardware, software and network support for PCs and PC-based peripherals.
Performs related work as assigned.


Minimum Education And Experience Requirements


Associate‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Business or Public Administration or related discipline.
One (1) year of relational database management, data analysis, or mini or mainframe operations experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


Louisville Metro Government is committed to providing our employees with the tools they need to lead a fit and healthy life. Aside from community-wide initiatives like the Mayor's Hike, Bike and Paddle event every Memorial Day and Labor Day, and the Healthy Hometown Movement, Metro Government provides employees with programs designed to enhance their life and well-being, like a Wellness Center that allows employees and their dependents with Metro health insurance to take care of their basic medical and health needs for a $5 co-pay. Louisville Metro Government understands that a team of healthy, vibrant employees is the greatest asset we have.

Dental
Vision

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the centre of our ambitions.

About The Digital GBUs

Sanofi‚Äôs Digital organization‚Äôs mission is to transform Sanofi into a data-first and AI first organization by empowering everyone with good data. Through custom developed AI products built on world class data foundations and platforms, the team builds value and a unique competitive advantage that scales across our markets, R&D and manufacturing sites. The team is located in major hubs in Paris, Lyon, Barcelona, Cambridge, Bridgewater, Toronto and most recently Budapest and Hyderabad. Join a dynamic, fast paced and talented Barcelona team, with world class mentorship, using AI to chase the miracle of science.

About Growing With Us

In this role you will develop globally scalable AI solutions (conventional AI & Generative AI) that are strategically prioritized by the Sanofi commercial area across Global Business Units (Pharma & Vaccines) for the betterment of our global patients and customers. Examples of AI projects include, but are not limited to, Next Best action driven Omnichannel Engagement, Leverage data & AI to identify Patient, enhanced & personalized Patient experience, Marketing Mix Model, AI Alerts to proactively identify the growth opportunities and Market dynamics product lines. You will specifically,


Apply data science expertise in machine learning, LLM, deep learning, statistics, text-mining/NLP, forecasting and optimization to multiple analytics projects
Build models, algorithms, simulations, and experiments by writing highly optimized code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologies
Work on full-spectrum of activities, from conducting ML experiments to delivering production-ready models
Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver AI-based data products
Work closely with product owners, developers, engineers, and MLOps to deliver AI/ML solutions
Adhere to and promote to best practices and standards for data science process (including documentation) and code developments
Remains up to date with industry practices and emerging technologies such as generative AI and test creative ways of offering AI solutions to enhance existing solutions
undefined


About You

Key Functional Requirements and qualifications


Hands-on AI/ML modeling experience of complex datasets combined with strong understanding of theoretical foundations of AI/ML
Expertise within most of the following areas: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, LLM, reinforcement learning, federated learning, time series forecasting, Bayesian statistics, optimization
Experience creating and deploying code libraries using functions, classes in Python in AI product-focused development under an agile environment
Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computing environments (e.g. AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark)
Experience in production-ready software development
Experience in communicating with business, expressing important DS concepts in a non-technical way, interpreting feedback from business
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, data visualization and data storytelling skills
Nice to have experience in life sciences and healthcare and experience in a complex global organization
A demonstrated ability to work and collaborate in a team environment
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment and to manage multiple priorities
Fluent in English (Other languages a plus)


Key Technical Requirements And Qualifications
