-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll play a critical role in productionizing and scaling our forecasting systems. From robust orchestration and delivery pipelines to smart automation of model lifecycles, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with data scientists, product engineers, and domain experts to deliver real-world impact.

This is a hands-on engineering role with high ownership and visibility across the company. You‚Äôll help ensure that our models don‚Äôt just work‚Äîbut work reliably, at scale, and with clear auditability.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Design and maintain scalable ML orchestration workflows (e.g., Airflow, Prefect, Kedro)
  • Develop and own micro services for data ingestion, model execution, and forecast delivery
  • Monitor pipeline performance, implement logging, error handling, and recovery strategies
  • Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, version, and optimize forecasting models in production
  • Build internal tooling and dashboards and contribute micro service support for frontend components
  • Implement auditability, observability, and automated reporting for ML systems
  • Continuously improve data and model infrastructure for speed, scalability, and maintainability
  • Participate in architectural planning as we scale our systems and customer base

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • 3-5 years of experience in backend engineering, ML infrastructure, or data platform roles
  • Strong Python skills and experience with orchestration tools and micro services
  • Solid understanding of PostgreSQL and data modeling best practices
  • Familiarity with API frameworks such as FastAPI or Flask
  • Experience in deploying and managing machine learning pipelines in production environments
  • Comfortable working independently and taking initiative in fast-paced, ambiguous settings
  • Strong communication skills (in English) and ability to collaborate across teams


Bonus points for:

  • Experience in forecasting, supply chain, or manufacturing domains
  • Familiarity with containerization, Docker, CI/CD, or cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Offer

  • A rare opportunity to build core systems at the heart of a high-impact product
  • A collaborative, high-performance culture led by experienced founders
  • Competitive compensation with potential equity upside
  • Flexible working hours and remote-friendly setup
  • Clear growth path toward technical leadership as the team expands

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let‚Äôs build a smarter, more sustainable supply chain ‚Äî together.

Apply now or reach out with questions!

Title: Junior Agentic AI Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_16) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior RAG Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_16

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior Agentic AI Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

  • Development and implementation of Agentic Solutions;
  • Create solutions for regulatory risk monitoring and compliance management;
  • Develop modules to manage complex regulatory documentation, continuously assessing compliance using advanced Agentic Solutions to provide context-aware risk assessments.

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;
  • Experience or strong interest in Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Interest in advancing AI solutions that maintain robust performance under diverse and challenging conditions;
  • Commitment to clear and honest communication of data and model limitations using established reporting standards and tools;
  • Interest in applied research;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • AI4CarOps ‚Äì AI-Powered Innovations for Car Workshop Operations, with Notice No. MPr-2023-07- SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. Projeto n¬∫ 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR).

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it‚Äôs AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Data Science Lead
HTML:
Who We Are


Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.


What We Offer


  • A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
  • Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
  • Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
  • Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
  • Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.


What you will do


  • Manage client interactions and play a key role in building and maintaining client relationships;
  • Apply knowledge of data science concepts to translate business problems to analytics solutions with clear output and with foreseen impactful outcomes;
  • Provide project management oversight required to meet client expectations;
  • Responsibilities may include the development of presentations and managing of external relationships;
  • Seek compelling opportunities beyond the scope of the current project;
  • Provide guidance to more junior members of the team, while orchestrating the work of the entire team.


What you‚Äôll bring


  • Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences);
  • Sharp thinking ability to be able to quickly differentiate major contributors from irrelevant details and to hierarchically structure information residing in the data under analysis;
  • Robust knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) to machine learning.
  • Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus;
  • Proven ability to manage projects with expert team members and to provide inspiring guidance to juniors in the team;
  • 5+ years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience, with at least 1+ years at a project lead level;
  • Excellent communication skills, especially to explain complex analytical concepts in non-technical terms to business users;
  • Professional fluency in English.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Start your exciting journey with Aubay right here

Aubay Portugal is a subsidiary of the multinational French company, Aubay Group, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Porto, we are a leading provider of consulting services, specializing in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems.

Our expertise spans a wide range of industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, energy, transportation, and services, where we collaborate with over 150 active partners to deliver innovative, tailored solutions.

At Aubay, we‚Äôre committed to empowering businesses through digital transformation, offering cutting-edge technology and deep industry knowledge to drive success.




What are you going to do

Develop and maintain software solutions using Python with a focus on clean, efficient code.
Create and manage automation scripts within Linux environments.
Utilize other scripting languages, especially Shell scripts, to support system and application tasks.
Use version control systems to manage codebase changes and collaborate with the development team.




What are we looking for

At least 6 years of solid experience in Python programming and development.
Strong background in scripting for Linux operating systems.
Proficiency with other scripting languages, particularly Shell scripting.
Experience using version control tools, with a preference for Git.




What do we offer you?

At Aubay, we believe in creating an environment where both your career and well-being thrive. Here's what you can expect when you join us:

Health Insurance: Your health and well-being are a priority.
Feedback&Coffee: A unique system that integrates Aubay's Performance Management Cycle with regular feedback sessions and a Career Progression Model, designed to foster your growth and success.
Working Model: Hybrid model with office in Porto/Braga.
A Tailored Training Academy: We‚Äôre dedicated to your professional development with both technical and behavioral training. From e-Learning and classroom sessions to Meet&Techs, Webinars, and Mentoring, we provide a variety of learning opportunities to suit your needs.
Exciting Events & Teambuilding: Enjoy a vibrant company culture through regular events and team-building activities that strengthen relationships and enhance collaboration.




What makes us different?

At Aubay, we foster a unique environment where people come first. Here‚Äôs what makes us different:

A Culture Built on Core Values: Our organizational culture thrives on transparency, team spirit, regular feedback, and continuous learning ‚Äî all designed to support your personal and professional growth.
Recognition & Rewards: Enjoy reference prizes and a birthday gift as a token of appreciation for being part of our team.
Freedom in Expression: We embrace a casual dress code, allowing you to feel comfortable and authentic at work.
A Friendly and Inclusive Atmosphere: At Aubay, we know your name, and we communicate informally ‚Äî fostering a relaxed, close-knit environment.
Grow with Us: You will grow alongside inspiring colleagues who support and challenge you. Isn't this the best way to develop professionally?




If we‚Äôve sparked your interest, we‚Äôre now ready to ignite your enthusiasm. Are you ready for the first step?

We are waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt!

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract; Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period). The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law. For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt. (please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Python Developer

Seniority: Mid-s√©nior




The amazing you, will have:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a python Developer;
Solid knowledge of Python, FastAPI, Sphinx, Helm, GitHub, Azure cloud resources, Docker
Fluency in the English language (mandatory) and portuguese;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto or Lisbon (Portugal);










Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Scientist - Gen AI Engineer
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
Data Scientist - Gen AI Engineer (Lisbon/Porto)

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

Develop, fine-tune, and deploy Generative AI models using AWS services like Bedrock, SageMaker, and Lambda.

Work with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models for applications in NLP, image generation, and AI automation.

Optimize prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) techniques.

Build scalable MLOps pipelines for training and deploying GenAI models using SageMaker, ECS, and Kubernetes.

Process and manage large-scale datasets for AI training using AWS Glue, Athena, and Redshift.

Implement vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, Amazon OpenSearch) for efficient retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications.

Design and optimize ETL pipelines for AI/ML data workflows.

Collaborate with software engineers, DevOps, and product teams to integrate AI models into applications and APIs.

Ensure security, compliance, and data privacy in AI/ML workflows.

Monitor AI model performance and retraining needs using AWS CloudWatch, MLFlow, and other observability tools.

YOUR PROFILE

Strong background in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Generative AI.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers).

Experience with AWS AI/ML services such as SageMaker, Bedrock, Lambda, and Comprehend.

Hands-on experience with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models.

Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and knowledge graphs.

Experience in MLOps, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS), and CI/CD for ML pipelines.

Solid understanding of cloud optimization, distributed computing, and model scaling.

Strong data engineering skills for processing large datasets in AWS Glue, Athena, or Spark.

Knowledge of NLP, image generation models, or multimodal AI solutions.

Nice To Have

Experience with fine-tuning open-source models (LLaMA, Falcon, Mistral, Stable Diffusion).

AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Machine Learning ‚Äì Specialty.

Experience with real-time AI applications, chatbot development, or autonomous agents.

Knowledge of ethical AI, bias mitigation, and AI safety best practices.

What You'll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Training and certifications programs.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Python Developer!




Responsibilities:

Primary goal will be to continually improve the core framework used for data integration and calculation of Market and Counterparty Risk Metrics.
Innovation is a key element of Risk Systems, so candidates will have the opportunity to collaborate in cross-team innovative projects and propose initiatives aligned with our top innovation priorities.
Develop and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications.
Ensure code documentation and organization.
Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements.
Resolve incidents in a production environment.
Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages.




Requirements:

Experience with Python.
Experience with SQL and any industry standard relational database.
Demonstrable ability to write clean and readable code
Solid understanding of both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
English required, both spoken and written.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com or career@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúPython‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Scientist - SAS & Python Specialist
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary¬†




Keyrus is seeking a Data Scientist -¬†SAS/Python Specialist to join a critical data transformation initiative, supporting the migration of legacy SAS processes to a modern, scalable Python-based platform. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimising data pipelines, ensuring performance, scalability, and alignment with business requirements.

Location: Portugal (Might require On-site attendance).
Start date: September¬†




Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and contribute to the migration of data workflows from SAS to Python, ensuring functionality and performance are maintained or improved
Design and implement robust Python solutions tailored to business and technical needs
Optimise existing data pipelines and develop new algorithms for improved efficiency and scalability
Collaborate closely with data engineers, analysts, and project stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver production-ready solutions
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues in Python processes
Document code, migration strategies, and technical solutions to support knowledge sharing and long-term maintainability




Requirements for the role¬†


5+ years of experience with Python, preferably in senior or lead roles
Strong background in PySpark or Scala for distributed data processing tasks
Solid knowledge of SQL, data structures, and algorithm optimisation techniques
Hands-on experience with¬†SAS, especially SAS Data Integration Studio
Proven experience mentoring or guiding junior team members
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus
Nice to have:¬†Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL best practices
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese¬†or European¬†citizen or have a work permit for Portugal

¬†

What we offer at Keyrus Portugal:

Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?


Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.¬†

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.¬†

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.¬†

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

¬†

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Python Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

You Must Have

  • Between 6-9 years of experience working in a similar role;
  • Strong proficiency in Pure Python;
  • Good understanding of Python libraries (Pandas);
  • Experience with SSAS and SSRS;
  • Power BI is a plus;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders;
  • Good level of English (B2).

What can you expect from us?

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Data Scientist (Mid-Senior)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
Your Role

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in contributing to the development and implementation of AI models and algorithms to address complex business challenges. Your key responsibilities will include:


Taking ownership of data science initiatives and projects, demonstrating a proactive and results-driven approach.
Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and providing data-driven recommendations.
Collaborating seamlessly with multidisciplinary teams to comprehend business needs, designing, and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms.
Leveraging big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks for processing and analyzing large volumes of data, or equivalent cloud computing expertise.
Developing and deploying predictive models and algorithms in real-world production environments.
Conducting comprehensive exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Effectively communicating finding and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Embracing a data-driven, solution-oriented, and critical mindset, fostering teamwork and collaboration.


Your Profile


2 or more years of experience in data science roles with a focus on statistical modeling, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages, including SQL, Python, and distributed/cloud processing framework such as Pyspark.
Exhibit familiarity with advanced analytics libraries/frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn.
Robust understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and various machine learning techniques.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and libraries such as Seaborn, Matplotlib, or Plotly.
Proven ability to work with large datasets and experience in distributed computing frameworks, either on-premises or in the cloud.
Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills for addressing complex data challenges.
Hold a solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Engineering, Data & AI, or Computer Sciences.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS is a plus)
Mandatory fluency in English.


What You'll Love You About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
Engage in exciting national and international projects;
Hybrid work;
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
Training and certifications programs;
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

  • Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
  • Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills for addressing complex data challenges.
  • Hold a solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Engineering, Data & AI, or Computer Sciences.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS is a plus)
  • Mandatory fluency in English.

What You'll Love You About Working Here

  • Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
  • Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
  • Engage in exciting national and international projects;
  • Hybrid work;
  • Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
  • Training and certifications programs;
  • Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
  • Great office locations.

About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are using and creating technology to transform operations at sea to enable people and the planet to thrive.




We are open-minded and fearless in our approach to innovation and don't believe in boundaries. We challenge everything and have massive ambitions to drag aging industries into the tech era.




We take safety, equality and education very seriously, and our responsibilities don't stop at our front door. Our business is built on the belief that there's definitely a more environmentally responsible way to operate at sea.




We employ people who share our core values. We expect our people to be courageous, trustworthy, and conscientious, driven by a desire to do the right thing. We strive for excellence, work collaboratively, and are genuinely excited by our work.




We offer opportunities for our people to develop beyond their role and span a multitude of disciplines. These are open to all, regardless of background and experience level. Working with us means being part of a team that is harnessing technology and creativity to disrupt a traditional industry.




We are not your average workplace.




Ocean Infinity is seeking an experienced python developer to support the AI team in developing and deploying cutting edge automation in the maritime industry. The position is part of a team that focuses on processing and analysing sonar data from subsea operations, and is reporting to the AI team lead.




What will you do:

Design, develop, and maintain Python applications and data pipelines to support the processing of maritime data.
Transform raw data into formats suitable for machine learning training and inference, and export results into user-friendly formats for operational teams and downstream systems.
Ensure code quality and maintainability by applying software engineering best practices, including modular design, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate closely with AI Engineers, ML Engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust and efficient solutions that bridge the gap between model development and production integration.
Perform data quality checks, troubleshoot processing issues, and implement preventive measures to ensure pipeline reliability and scalability.
Build prototypes and proof-of-concept applications to validate new approaches or technologies.
Deploy and support services in production environments, ensuring performance, reliability, and maintainability.
Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by identifying inefficiencies and proposing enhancements to infrastructure and workflows.




Who you are:

A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Familiarity with Linux/WSL.
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and data modelling.
Experience in working with JIRA and Confluence in an Agile environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive problem-solving mind.




Desirable:

Experience with data engineering/data pipelines.
Experience with Docker.
Experience implementing continuous integration and/or continuous deployment.
Experience with frontend development.




Salary for this position: Up to ‚Ç¨50,000 per annum




Salary: The salary varies for this position as we are recruiting in multiple regional locations and job grades. The salary process is based on skills, abilities, and experience required.




What you can expect:




At Ocean Infinity, we believe in creating equal opportunities for all, celebrating each and everyone‚Äôs differences. We are driven by transforming the industry, through our technology, thoughts, behaviours and actions. Being inclusive and respectful to all is fundamental to who we are. It is the right thing to do and enables innovation and creativity to thrive.




There is more work to be done, and we know that we aren‚Äôt perfect, but our commitment to these values is unwavering. They are central to our mission and the impact we have on the industry, meaning, we cannot live without them.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
About the Company




Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.




Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.




Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.




About the Role




The Developer's mission is to contribute to the functional and application related consistency of the IT solution and ensure the service continuity and continuous development. The Developer must perform activities within the framework of projects and/or application maintenance and development, seeking it‚Äôs continuous development and assuring it‚Äôs compliance with Quality and Security guidelines and best practices.







Main Tasks:




Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.




Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.




Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.




Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.







Technical Skills:




Python Programming




Flask / Fast API




SQL




JavaScript




Angular







Language Skills




English







Send your CV & join our team!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That‚Äôs why, if you have at least 3 years of experience as a Python Developer we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!




Mandatory skills requested for this position:

Strong technical expertise in Python (Native and frameworks);
Significant experience in industrializing developments (Design Patterns, DevOps, standards, clean code, best practices);
Pedagogical qualities adapted to supporting the developers on the platform.




Technical Skills:




Notable experience in enterprise software development/Software Engineering (Git, Gitlab, unit tests, etc.)
Expertise in Python (at least 3.9) and its ecosystem (libraries, Anaconda, Jupyter, VS Code, etc.)
Expertise in computational libraries and data manipulation (NumPy, Pandas, etc.)
Expertise in parallelization and performance optimization (Dask, Spark, GPU optimization, Cuda, Cupy, etc.)
Expertise in industrializing Python developments (development standards, Design patterns, TDD, etc.)
Ability to understand functional needs and translate them into IT requirements
Creation of Python packages
DevOps: Jira, CI/CD, Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Artifactory, shell script, Docker, Hashicorp Vault, Jfrog
Code quality: Fortify, Nexus IQ, Sonarqube
Databases: Oracle, PostgreSQL, Netezza
File management: S3, Boto3, IBM COS, Minio
Data Engineering, data manipulation, data exploration, data quality, etc.
Ability to challenge project stakeholders (e.g., Business, MOA, MOE)
High level of English.




What can we offer you?

Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.
Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment‚Äîinnovative and dynamic.
Specialized training and ongoing professional development.
Social benefits.
Competitive salary.




Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Portuguese market.

If you like numbers, we can tell you that in Portugal we have a revenue of 10.9 million euros, 2 headquarters, and a team of 215 professionals.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

Title: Python Backend
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Python Backend

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Lisbon. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Minimum of 4 to 5 years of proven experience as a Backend Developer.
Strong knowledge of Python for backend development.
Experience with frameworks such as Django and/or FastAPI.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and non-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Experience with RESTful APIs and good API design practices.
Proficiency with version control systems (Git).
Fluent English (spoken and written) ‚Äì used daily in the work environment.
Experience with Docker, ideally also Kubernetes.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience with automated testing (Pytest, unittest, etc.).
Understanding of microservices architectures.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements

Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages

Python

Advanced English

Social benefits.

Title: Data Science Software Developer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary¬†

Keyrus is looking for¬†a Data Science Software Developer to build high-quality tools, applications, and packages in R and Python that support scientific research, analytics, and business processes.¬†

This role combines software engineering practices with a strong understanding of data workflows, aiming to create user-friendly, reliable, and validated software for internal teams.

Experience in the pharmaceutical or healthcare domain is a plus, especially with familiarity around clinical development standards and regulated environments.


Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.
It is a full remote role based in Portugal.¬†
Starting date: October 2025




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with statisticians, programmers, and data scientists to translate analytical and business needs into functional, scalable software tools and packages.
Design, develop, test, and maintain enterprise-grade applications and reusable packages using R, Python, and associated frameworks (e.g., Shiny, Dash).
Integrate applications with SQL/NoSQL databases and manage data access securely and efficiently.
Develop and document validated GxP-compliant tools, following Computer System Validation (CSV) processes and relevant regulatory frameworks.
Create user and technical documentation, and provide training or workshops as needed.
Track and manage development progress, issues, and enhancements using tools like GitHub or JIRA, applying Agile development practices.
Maintain tools post-deployment, releasing regular updates and responding to user feedback.
Contribute to innovation projects and provide subject matter expertise in internal product development and change initiatives.




Requirements for the role¬†


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong experience in R and Python programming, especially for building applications and reusable packages.
Proven ability in full-cycle software development:
Application architecture
Integration with databases
Code modularization and reuse
Version control (Git)
Testing and debugging
Deployment and scaling
Strong communication skills, with the ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience using GitHub or similar tools for source control and collaborative development.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese¬†or European¬†citizen or have a work permit for Portugal

¬†

Good to have:

Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, particularly in support of Shiny or web-based applications.

Applied experience in clinical development or biopharma environments.
Knowledge of CDISC standards and regulatory frameworks relevant to pharma.

Experience delivering validated tools in a GxP-regulated context.




What we offer at Keyrus Portugal:

Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?


Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.¬†

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.¬†

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.¬†

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

¬†

Title: Python Backend Developer (HYBRID @PORTO)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: PYTHON Developer

Seniority: 4+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in software development with Python, with a strong background in backend development.
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, and software engineering best practices.
Comfortable working with SQL and No-SQL Databases.
Basic knowledge of the Linux command line.
Experience with Clouds, Rest API‚Äôs and Microservices Architectures.
DevOps mindset (CI/CD knowledge) and experience with tests.
Understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum, and experience working in collaborative development environments.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to quickly understand and debug complex software applications.
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal).
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Related Certifications.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Computer Vision
Description:
We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist who is not only technically proficient but also a proven leader and innovator. You will be instrumental in driving our data science initiatives forward, ensuring all our work adheres to the highest standards of the medical device industry. This is an opportunity to make a significant and immediate impact. We are looking for a candidate with a robust background and a passion for data science, particularly within the medical field.




Qualifications




You have a PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
You can effectively translate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You have proven leadership experience with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects.
You have extensive hands-on experience with image models and relevant deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
You have deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services relevant to data science, including Vertex AI, AI Platform, Cloud Storage, Compute Engine, Dataflow, and BigQuery for large-scale data warehousing and analytics.
You have a strong understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and experience working with MLOps pipelines.
You have solid experience navigating data compliance challenges within the medical field and with medical devices. This includes familiarity with regulations like HIPAA, GDPR standards, and an understanding of the unique data challenges and ethical considerations inherent in this critical industry.







Key Responsibilities




Leading the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models specifically for medical device applications.
Guiding the team in selecting appropriate methodologies, algorithms, and tools for diverse data science problems.
Ensuring the scalability, robustness, and maintainability of data science solutions in a production environment.
Overseeing and architecting the entire data lifecycle, from ingestion and transformation to storage and access, while ensuring data quality and availability.
Spearheading data compliance efforts within the data science team, ensuring strict adherence to regulations pertinent to the medical field and medical devices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, FDA regulations, ISO 13485, MDR/IVDR, and the Data Act).
Collaborating closely with legal, regulatory, product and quality assurance teams to ensure all data science initiatives meet the highest compliance standards.
Providing technical guidance and mentorship to junior and mid-level data scientists, fostering their growth and skill development.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative spirit.
Contributing to the strategic direction of the data science team, aligning data initiatives with broader business objectives.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Mission

The Developer's mission is to contribute to the functional and application related consistency of the IT solution and ensure the service continuity and continuous development. The Developer must perform activities within the framework of projects and/or application maintenance and development, seeking it‚Äôs continuous development and assuring it‚Äôs compliance with Quality and Security guidelines and best practices.

Main Tasks


Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.


Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Ready to make a positive difference in healthcare? My client is a well-funded start-up at the forefront of medical device technology. They are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their top-tier data science team in Porto (UPTEC Asprela).




They have patented diagnostic technology already making a difference to patients, and FDA approval is on the horizon. There has never been a better time to join their elite team of physicians, software engineers, and data scientists!




This is what your day to day will look like:

Leading the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models specifically for medical device applications
Translating complex technical concepts to internal and external stakeholders
Championing data compliance efforts (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, FDA regulations, ISO 13485, MDR/IVDR, and the Data Act)
Guiding the team in selecting appropriate methodologies, algorithms, and tools for diverse data science problems
Driving data science initiatives forward
Supporting the mission to revolutionize healthcare




If you have these technical skills, you will be a great fit:

Expertise in Google Cloud - Vertex AI, AI Platform, Cloud Storage, Dataflow
PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Biomedical Engineering or a similar field
Deep learning frameworks - TensorFlow and PyTorch
Infrastructure as code principles
Hands-on experience with MLOps pipelines and tools




Technical expertise aside, we are looking for you to be objective-focused. You will react well to rapidly changing priorities whilst never losing sight of the bigger picture.




You will take pride in ownership and delivery of complex projects. We are hiring for the long term, so growth to a Lead role is on the roadmap. Come and embrace the future with us!




Interested in finding out more?

This is a senior, permanent hire and the salary range is ‚Ç¨55,000 - ‚Ç¨65,000 p.a. + life assurance, pension, and future stock options. Remote or Hybrid to Porto offices can be discussed at interview.




Atomic Talent is the agency exclusively handling this position, and we are happy to speak about this opportunity in the first instance via email (tom@atomic-talent.com) or here on LinkedIn. We respond to everyone, so please apply even if you feel that you only hit 70% of the requirements.

Title: Junior RAG Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior RAG Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior RAG Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

  • Development and implementation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Systems;
  • Create advanced RAG pipelines, semantically fusing technical documentation and logs;
  • Develop modules to manage complex documentation using advanced Large Language Models (LLMs).

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;
  • Experience or strong interest in Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Interest in advancing AI solutions that maintain robust performance under diverse and challenging conditions;
  • Commitment to clear and honest communication of data and model limitations using established reporting standards and tools;
  • Interest in applied research;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • AI4CarOps ‚Äì AI-Powered Innovations for Car Workshop Operations, with Notice No. MPr-2023-07- SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. Projeto n¬∫ 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR).

Title: Investigador
Description:
Research Opportunities

Computer Science




Work description

This position is part of the project "Alian√ßa para a transi√ß√£o Energ√©tica" - (Alliance for the Energy Transition) where a multi-tenant, cloud-based solution to enable an integrated set of cross-domain, interoperable digital services with data from several domains will be design, while allowing a simple instantiation for distinct stakeholders along the energy value-chain. The work plan is based on analysing, designing, implementing and testing software components of the platform above in a public cloud provider environment. The focus will be particularly on using Microsoft Azure. The specific objectives are detailed in the objectives section.




Academic Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering or a related field.




Minimum profile required

Knowledge and experience in the development of Java applications.
Knowledge and experience with orchestration tools in some of the following cloud providers MS Azure
Knowledge and experience with the following database management systems: PostgreSQL, Mongo DB.
Knowledge and experience with the following virtualization/orchestration tools: Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes.
Knowledge and experience with Linux operating systems.
Language skills (written and spoken) for Portuguese and English.




Preference factors

Knowledge and experience with Spring Boot and/or Angular Framework. h) Knowledge and experience with Rest APIs.
Knowledge and experience in the usage of CI/CD integration tools.




Application Period

Since 24 Jul 2025 to 06 Aug 2025




Centre

High-Assurance Software




Scientific Advisor

F√°bio Andr√© Coelho




What we offer

Multicultural and collaborative environment - A multicultural, international and collaborative environment that makes it easier to exchange ideas, work in networks and create synergies.
International projects - The possibility of working in international projects with some of the most important companies in the field.
Mentoring - Mentoring with the best researchers in the fields of electrical and industrial engineering, bioengineering, information technology and physics.
Self Improvement - The possibility of participating in international conferences, workshops, seminars and vocational training.
Other Benefits and Perks: Flexible working time, health insurance, discounts in hotels, transportation, etc.

Title: Full Stack Developer (Python, React)
Description:
We are looking for a talented Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team, someone who specializes in Python /Django and has solid knowledge of React and React Native. Is that you?

If yes, join us at Mobiweb, a Software House & Nearshore from Porto, established in 2017. Our specialities are Web and Mobile App Development on native and cross-platform technologies. We develop in-house products, but also work with companies of all sizes and geographies, from start-ups like Moomenti (Switzerland / USA) to powerhouses of the Telco and Media sectors, such as Sky (UK).‚ÄØ

We believe only Happy People can deliver the best products, so Team Morale is front and centre for us.‚ÄØ

We also believe Sharing is Caring, especially when it comes to knowledge. We take in very experienced developers, but also fresh-out-of-school programmers, and we expect everyone to collaborate to reach the best outcomes, teaching and learning.

Our Ultimate Goal is to make a positive impact on people's lives and businesses by developing custom and innovative solutions for our clients.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

We are in the Work Hard, Play Hard business. Can you handle it?‚ÄØ

That‚Äôs all very nice, but what‚Äôs in it for you?‚ÄØ

üí∞ Competitive salary (gross + benefits*, based on experience)

üéÜ End of the year Bonus based on the company‚Äôs performance

üíª High-quality equipment (You get a Mac, and you get a Mac, everyone gets a Mac!)‚ÄØ

üéÇ Paid time off on your birthday‚ÄØ

üè• Health Insurance‚ÄØ


Monthly Benefits that you can spend on Technology, Childcare, Transportation, Health, etc.


Still not convinced. Well, here are a few more:‚ÄØ

üìñ This is an ever-evolving industry, so we promote Continuous Learning with free access to Udemy‚ÄØ

‚è∞ Are you an early riser or a night-owl? It doesn‚Äôt matter, the working hours are Flexible‚ÄØ

üèñÔ∏è Work from wherever you want in Portugal (although, we have a fantastic office üòé)‚ÄØ

‚úàÔ∏è If you like travelling, we might get you an International Project‚ÄØ

üëï The mandatory dress code is ‚Äúwhatever you like‚Äù‚ÄØ

ü•≥ Monthly Get-Togethers and an Annual Big Event‚ÄØ

üë™ Family Comes First, no ifs or buts‚ÄØ

‚öΩ Foosball

Are you still reading? That‚Äôs interesting! Since you‚Äôre still here, we might as well tell you what you‚Äôll need to be considered for this position:‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ


You have 3+ years of professional IT experience
Proven experience with Python and Django framework
Solid knowledge of React, Redux, JavaScript, TypeScript
You have experience working with REST APIs and third-party libraries
You have good knowledge of English, both spoken and written


Got all of that covered? Great stuff! Now have a look into what you should know to be successful in this role:‚ÄØ


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar
Understand relational and non-relational databases
Are familiar with security protocols and best practices
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Exposure to DevOps practices and automated deployments
Previous work in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Knowledge of component-based front-end architecture and micro-frontends


If you got this far you are committed! We want to know you, apply today! üöÄ‚ÄØ

PS: Have a look into our office üëá

Note: As a potential candidate for this position, you understand and agree that the information provided in your job application, including your resume and cover letter, is strictly confidential. We assure you that this information will not be disclosed to your current employer or any third party without your written consent. By submitting your application, you affirm that all information is true and accurate to the best of your knowledge.
